examples: very particular about how her food was prepared

results.definition: a small part that can be considered separately from the whole

examples: she gets special (or particular) satisfaction from her volunteer work

results.definition: (logic) a proposition that asserts something about some (but not all) members of a class
surpassing what is common or usual or expected
examples: a matter of particular and unusual importance

results.definition: unique or specific to a person or thing or category
examples: the particular demands of the job
has a particular preference for Chinese art

results.definition: a fact about some part (as opposed to general)
examples: he always reasons from the particular to the general
a particular description of the room

results.definition: separate and distinct from others of the same group or category
examples: a man who wishes to make a particular woman fall in love with him
